attributes.action: Get rid of street works permits whose costs will be passed to customers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Utility companies can be charged by highway authorities ( Councils)  up to £240 per excavation in a public street to provide services to their customers, under the terms of the Traffic Management Act 2004 .  It is likely that these costs will be added to the bills of their customers themselves by the companies.  This is an unfair tax on householders, coming on the back of recent utility high price rises.  It should be thrown out, to ensure that costs are kept manageable.
